model_reasoning.description: Z-Image-i2L (Image to LoRA) converts reference style images into a LoRA model that can be used for text-to-image generation. Upload 3-4 images showing a consistent style, and the model will generate a LoRA adapter that captures that style for use with the Z-Image text-to-image model.

image_to_lora.recommended_images: Upload 2+ images that showcase a consistent style or visual characteristic. More images generally capture the style better!
image_to_lora.explanation: The i2L pipeline encodes reference images into a LoRA representation that captures their visual style

inference.negative_prompt_chinese: 泛黄，发绿，模糊，低分辨率，低质量图像，扭曲的肢体，诡异的外观，丑陋，AI感，噪点，网格感，JPEG压缩条纹，异常的肢体，水印，乱码，意义不明的字符
inference.negative_prompt_english: Yellowed, green-tinted, blurry, low-resolution, low-quality image, distorted limbs, eerie appearance, ugly, AI-looking, noise, grid-like artifacts, JPEG compression artifacts, abnormal limbs, watermark, garbled text, meaningless characters
inference.explanation:
- cfg_scale: Set to 4 (recommended for i2L, not standard 7.5) for optimal quality
- sigma_shift: Set to 8 (recommended for i2L) to enhance style retention
- num_inference_steps: Denoising steps (50 recommended)
- positive_only_lora: Apply LoRA only to positive prompts, disable on negative prompts for better quality
- negative_prompt: Use provided Chinese or English prompts to improve image quality

training.note: Z-Image-i2L does not use traditional LoRA training. Instead, it generates LoRA from reference images in a single forward pass.
